data.title: Woman arrested after Thai-British beauty queen loses B4m in 'fake cop' scam
data.description: A woman, 40, was arrested in Chaiyaphum province for allegedly opening a  mule bank account  for a Cambodia-based  scam gang  that tricked Thai-British beauty queen  Charlotte Austin  out of 4 million baht.

data.title: Total cost of online scams revealed
data.description: Online scams cost victims 77.36 billion baht in damages from March 1, 2022, to November 30 this year, government spokesman Karom Polpornklang reported on Sunday.

data.title: 80 marching bands face-off in Thailand World Music Championships
data.description: Thailand World Music Championships (TWMC), a contest among over 80 marching bands from seven countries, is scheduled to take place in Si Sa Ket province from December 18-21.

data.title: Thai golfers Patty Tavatanakit, Jeeno Thitikul shine at Grant Thornton Invitational
data.description: Patty Tavatanakit of Thailand and Jake Knapp recorded seven birdies to extend their lead during windy and wet conditions at the Grant Thornton Invitational on Saturday at Tiburon Golf Club in Naples, Florida, US.

data.title: Australia says 'Bali Nine' prisoners have returned home
data.description: The five remaining members of the Australian "Bali Nine" drug ring have returned home after 19 years in jail in Indonesia, the Australian government said Sunday.

data.title: A chance to visit 3 World Heritage sites on ‘Royal Blossom’ train
data.description: The luxury “Royal Blossom” train will visit three UNESCO World Heritage sites in Nakhon Ratchasima province on December 23-24.

data.title: Car, power lines damaged by mishap during building demolition
data.description: The demolition of the Srifuengfung Building in Bang Rak district was suspended following an incident on Saturday, according to the Bangkok Metropolitan Administration (BMA).

data.title: Saudi Arabian couple survive after Jet Ski capsizes off Pattaya
data.description: PATTAYA: A Saudi Arabian couple were rescued safely after their Jet Ski capsized a few kilometres off Jomtien beach.

data.title: Bangkokians oppose congestion charge, support waste collection fee: poll
data.description: A majority of Bangkokians disagree with the planned traffic congestion charge in the capital but supported its new garbage collection fee aimed at encouraging waste separation, according to an opinion survey by the National Institute of Development Administration, or NIDA Poll.

data.title: Maple leaves undergoing their colourful annual phenomenon
data.description: The captivating phenomenon of maple leaves changing colours amid thick fog and cool weather is ready to greet visitors at Phu Hin Rong Kla National Park in Phitsanulok province.

data.title: Train and bus services to the South derailed by floods
data.description: Buses and train schedules as well as routes to the South were adjusted or suspended on Saturday following floods caused by heavy rains in Chumphon province.

data.title: Teachers' Council of Thailand and partners launch Thai-US Joint Degree Program
data.description: Thailand takes its first step in launching the Thai-US Joint-Degree Sandbox for STEM Teacher Education Program.

data.title: Green hydrogen and the challenges for Thailand
data.description: Amidst climate change and the global commitment to limit the rise in temperatures to less than 1.5°C, countries have pledged to accelerate climate policies aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions as part of their National Determined Contribution (NDC) targets.

data.title: The future of AI in the building, design and construction field
data.description: The integration of Artificial Intelligence (AI) into the architecture, engineering, and construction (AEC) industries is creating transformative opportunities, from streamlining design processes to enhancing project management.

data.title: UOB extends Bangchak group THB6.5 billion loan for Thailand’s first SAF plant
data.description: UOB Thailand has extended loans under its Transition Finance Framework of five billion baht to Bangchak Corporation PCL and 1.5 billion baht to BSGF Co., Ltd. to finance the construction, development, and working capital of Thailand’s first Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) project.
